definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: The money I receive is gross and has not been taxed.
sentences.chinese: 我收到的錢是總的稅前收入，沒有扣過稅的。

sentences.english: Anka's Quoted Tuition Rate is the net price before taxes.
sentences.chinese: 本校報價的學費是稅前價格。

sentences.english: She started by having 8% of her pre-tax income set aside in her employer’s retirement plan.
sentences.chinese: 她從僱主的退休計劃中留出稅前收入的8%。

sentences.english: That suggests a sticker price of at least $30, 000 before taxes for a mid-range version.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着一箇中等版本的車稅前標價至少爲三萬美元。

sentences.english: Secondly, improve the loan loss ratio of pre-tax deduction.
sentences.chinese: 提高貸款損失準備金的稅前扣除比例。

sentences.english: It made a pre-tax profit of 52m pound over the same period last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年同期，英航獲得了5200萬英鎊的稅前利潤。

definition: to add up the total/to figure what sth amounts to/to consider
remittance/funds paid to a bank account
